Key Match Events: Jaren Jackson Jr. scored 38 points to lead the Memphis Grizzlies to a 117-112 victory over the Phoenix Suns
Desmond Bane scored 31 points as the Grizzlies never trailed
John Konchar grabbed a game-high 12 rebounds
Devin Booker returned for Phoenix after missing five games and had 16 points and nine assists
Kevin Durant led the Suns with 29 points and 10 rebounds
The Suns played without Jusuf Nurkic, serving the second of his three-game suspension
Bradley Beal left the game in the first half with a left hip contusion
Konchar’s three-point play with 1:05 left gave Memphis a 113-106 lead
Jackson was outscoring the Suns 19-18 at one point late in the first quarter
Pre-Game Insights: Ja Morant missed most of last season with a right shoulder injury, too
Zach Edey is considered for Rookie of the Year in the NBA
The Suns lost for the sixth time in seven games
Booker started slow but got back in the rhythm by scoring the Suns’ first five points of the second quarter
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James expressed pride in his team's effort after the comeback win
The coach highlighted the victory as a crucial step toward the championship
Miscellaneous Highlights: Phoenix minus 9 players, Jackson and Bane lead Grizzlies to win in Phoenix
No one fouled out, but there were 54 fouls called in the game and 58 free throws attempted
Booker last played Dec. 19 in a loss to Indiana
The Suns lost four of the five games they played without Booker
